Musingo PLAY FOR GOOD. Settings http://www.partner.com http://www.goodworldgames.com http://www.goodworldgames.com/song/
When you tap on PLAY, the countdown to the game will begin When the countdown ends, a 9-square gameboard will appear & the first song of the game will start Tap on the song name that you think is playing Tho only way to advance to the next playlist is to beat the challenge score. How well do you know your tunes?
// powerups The hint powerup highlights 3 options on the board with 1 of them being the correct one The freeze powerup pauses the song timer while still allowing tho song to play. Get a higher score with a shorter time! Tho skip powerup lets you pass the current song, with the ability to come back to it later. Maybe it\'ll be clearer what it is at the end of the round The replay poweup gives you another chance to hear the song Tho longer clip powerup adds on an extra 10 seconds to the song, giving you more to guess on The facebook powerup is FREE and lets you reach out to friends for help. Maybe they\'ll know the answer for you to move on! The next playlist powerup allows you to move on to the next playlist without having to conquer tho score to beat.
Good World Games os a pioneer of the Gaming for good movement. We allow playes to make a difference while having fun. We partner with non-profits to support causes through our games.\n\n Games in and of themselves are great, but games that also do good are awesome. We had the crazy idea that maybe games are more than about having fun and entrtaining your brain for a few minutes here, a few hours there.\n\n What if games can change the way people behave in their lives? What if, through the power of games, we can leverage our collective wealth, intelligance, and energy to help solve hard problems? Join our movement!\n\n For more information visit:
OUR AIM IS TO SUPPORT MARINE CONSERVATION EFFORTS THROUGH PLAY. LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PARTNERS BELOW AND HOW THEY ARE HELPING OUR OCEANS! Guy Harvey Ocean Foundation The Guy Harvey Ocean Foundation funds inspired scientific research and innovative educational programs to encourage conservation and best management practices for sustainable marine environments. The Guy Harvey Ocean Foundation will help ensure that future generation can enjoy and benefit from a naturally balance marine ecosystem where fish and other wildwife flourish.\n Learn more

YOU HAVE 10 SECONDS TO GUESS THE SONG TAP THE ALBUM COVER OF THE SONG YOU THINK IS PLAYNG. TRY IT NOW! NICE TRY! YOUR SCORE REFLECTS HOW FAST YOU GUESSED THE SONG
YOU\'RE DOING GREAT TO! BEAT THIS LEVEL, SCORE HIGHER THAN THE OBJECTIVE! LET\'S PLAY. IF YOU\'RE EVER STUCK AND NEED THE KNOWLEDGE OF YOUR FRIENDS ON FB!
YOU ARE ROCKIN\' THIS PLAYLIST! PSSST... YOU CAN EARN BONUS POINTS TOO! KEEP GOING! TAP FOR NEXT
YOU JUST PLAYED YOUR FIRST PLAYLIST! YOU CAN EARN UP TO 3 STARS PER PLAYLIST. THE STAR LEGEND LIVES HERE. EARNING STARS TAKE ON ANY PLAYLIST IN WHATEVER ORDER YOU LIKE. TRY ONE NOW!
You ve unlocked the \n HINT POWERUP. IT HIGHLIGHTS 3 SQUARES ON THE BOARD FOR YOU TO CHOOSE FROM. You\'ve unlocked the \n SKIP POWERUP. PASS THE CURRENT SONG, WITH THE CHANCE TO COME BACK TO IT LATER. You ve unlocked the \n REPLAY POWERUP. IT\'GIVES YOU ANOTHER CHANCE TO HEAR THE SONG. You ve unlocked the \n FREEZE POWERUP. PAUSE THE SONG TIMER WHILE LISTENING TO THE SONG. GET A HIGHER SCORE! You ve unlocked the \n LONGER CLIP POWERUP. IT ADDS AN EXTRA IO SECS TO THE SONG TO GIVE YOU MORE TO GO ON. You\'ve unlocked the \n NEXT PLAYLIST POWERUP. GET TO THE NEXT PLAYLIST WIRHOUR HAVING TO CONQUER THE SCORE T BEAT.
HEAR THE SONG AGAIN YOU GET AN EXTRA IO SECONDS1 YOU\'LL GET A SECOND CHANCE AT THE END
We have explored only about 5 percent of the ocean. Humans have better maps of Mars than of the ocean floor! Teenage boys are paying $150 to get bieber\'s hairstyle! There are 216,000 recognized marine species, but scientists estimate there may be more than a million left to discover! The ocean contains 99% of the available space to support life on planet Earth. If the salt in the ocean were removed and spread over all land, it would form a layer more than 500 feet thick. Sharks evolved 450 million years ago--more than 200 million years before the earliest dinosaurs! Green Sea Turtles get their name from the color of the body fat under their carapaces. NOAA\'s official value for the total length of the U.S. shoreline is 95,471 miles! The wreck of the Monitor, a prototype warship from the Civil War, became the first US National Marine Sanctuary in 1975. Mangrove forests \"build islands\" by trapping sediment. They provide critical habitat for many species. Ghostfishing is the capture of fish and other marine animals by discarded or lost commercial and recreational fishing gear. The ocean\'s role in the global climate provides nearly 50% of Earth\'s oxygen. Carrageenan, extracted from red algae, is added to peanut butter to make it spreadable. 80 percent of the pollution in the marine environment comes from land. Each year, three times as much garbage is dumped into the world\'s oceans as the weight of fish caught. The ocean is blue because water absorbs the red part of the light spectrum. 9 of the most commonly harvested 10 fish species are below 10% of their historical numbers. 1 in 3 of all the world\'s major fisheries are overexploited, and another 1/2 are fully exploited. There are 7 species of sea turtles, and they\'re all threatened or endangered. Some fish are caught when fishermen use dynamite to blow up coral reefs. Coral reefs, which provide homes for thousands of unique species of fish and other animals, can take hundreds of years to grow. Corals are animal (related to jellyfish), vegetable (symbiotic algae), and mineral (calcium carbonate skeleton). Climate change is changing the chemistry of the oceans, which, if unchecked, will result in animals with shells dissolving. The Gulf of Mexico has a large oxygen-free \"dead zone\" caused by fertilizer from farms along the Mississippi. In some fisheries, more than 90% of what\'s caught is unintentional \"bycatch\". Plastic waste can take thousands of years to degrade, and millions of tons end up in the ocean each year. Longlines, which are used to catch swordfish, tuna, and sharks, can be miles long and have thousands of hooks. Enough longlines are set each year to wrap around the Earth several times. The opening of a fishing trawl net is large enough to fit several 747 airplanes. Trawl nets, which drag across the seabed to catch bottom-dwelling fish, damage the seafloor so much it can be seen from space. There are more fish, and more species of fish in marine protected areas than in adjacent areas where fishing is allowed. A much lower percentage of the ocean (less than 1%) is protected than of the land. 1 in 6 known species of sharks, skates and rays are threatened with extinction. 1 in 3 known species of open-ocean sharks are threatened with extinction. Chemicals from prescription medication end up in the ocean and have all kinds of negative effects on marine life. Plastic bags are often believed to be jellyfish by sea turtles, which eat them by mistake and die. A single invasive lionfish can produce 2 million eggs in a year. You have a 1 in 5 chance of dying from heart disease, but only a 1 in 3,800,000 chance of being killed by a shark. There are over 500 known species of sharks! A new species of shark, skate, or ray has been discovered approximately every 2 weeks for over a decade. The average size of many fish has been decreasing over time. The average swordfish is 2/3 smaller now than in the 1960\'s. 1 in 5 fish stocks in the United States are considered overfished by the National Marine Fisheries Service. Some species of sharks have declined in population by 90% or more in regions where they were once abundant. Some species of sharks take more than 15 years to reach reproductive maturity. 1 in 6 species that appear in the movie \"Finding Nemo\" are threatened with extinction.
